title: Ticket #2381: Condor only detects 32 out of 40 physical cores on a Win2k8 R2 machine
description:
The condor_startd only lists out 32 processors for the machine on start up. It stops at 32 CPUs every time when it's listing them out at the start of its log.

You can force it to 40 by setting NUM_CPUS.

OS is 64-bit Windows 2008 Server Enterprise Edition R2.

TJ's Note - this is a consequence of the fact that we are a 32 bit app. As a 32 bit app on a 64 bit machine we need to call GetNativeSystemInfo to get the actual number of CPUs.
remarks:
2011-Aug-22 13:19:42 by ichesal:

FWIW I had never intended this ticket to be for discussing the comm issues. Just the failure of the code that's used to detect physical cores in Windows. This sample program uses the same struct as Condor and it also returns on 32-cores for the machine (despite Windows reporting 40 cores in the 'About Machine' UI). 

#include <Windows.h>
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int _tmain(int argc, _TCHAR* argv[])
{
	SYSTEM_INFO si;
	GetSystemInfo(&si);
	cout << "System Processor Information:" << endl;
	cout << "  dwNumberOfProcessors = " << si.dwNumberOfProcessors << endl;
	cout << "  dwProcessorType      = " << si.dwProcessorType << endl;
	cout << "  wProcessorLevel      = " << si.wProcessorLevel << endl;
	cout << "  wProcessorRevision   = " << si.wProcessorRevision << endl;
	cout << endl;
	return 0;
}
{/code}

Compiled as a 32-bit console application and run on the 40-core box in question has dwNumberOfProcessors set to 32.

#include <Windows.h>
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int _tmain(int argc, _TCHAR* argv[])
{
	SYSTEM_INFO si, sj;
	GetSystemInfo(&si);
	cout << "GetSystemInfo Information:" << endl;
	cout << "  dwNumberOfProcessors = " << si.dwNumberOfProcessors << endl;
	cout << "  dwProcessorType      = " << si.dwProcessorType << endl;
	cout << "  wProcessorLevel      = " << si.wProcessorLevel << endl;
	cout << "  wProcessorRevision   = " << si.wProcessorRevision << endl;
	cout << endl;

	GetNativeSystemInfo(&sj);
	cout << "GetNativeSystemInfo Information:" << endl;
	cout << "  dwNumberOfProcessors = " << sj.dwNumberOfProcessors << endl;
	cout << "  dwProcessorType      = " << sj.dwProcessorType << endl;
	cout << "  wProcessorLevel      = " << sj.wProcessorLevel << endl;
	cout << "  wProcessorRevision   = " << sj.wProcessorRevision << endl;
	cout << endl;

	return 0;
}
